name: Westin Resort & Spa Puerto Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice place. Not spectacular but very nice. The place is immaculate, personnel very pleasant and, in this off season, the price seemed right. We paid $165 and because of our gold card got a great two story room. The Heavenly Bed was as advertized. The bell men are terrific. Also had a wonderful Saturday brunch.
reviews.title: A very nice place

reviews.text: This was an amazing trip. The entire staff was amazing and made you feel like family. When booking, keep in mind there is a huge difference between the Westin Resort and Spa (the hotel) and the Westin Regina (the timeshare). You will have a much better time, as I did, staying at the Resort and Spa which is a hotel property. The properties are physically connected, but it is a different experience. The staff had wonderful suggestions on where to go, Barcelona Tapas and Agave Grill were two of the best meals I've ever had in my entire life.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite a great location, well-kept facilities, and impeccable service, my experience at the Westin was marred by the money-grubbing greediness of its owners, who were ready to charge a fortune for every little item/service. Here are the facts:
reviews.title: Extremely overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fact: situated at the tip of Marina Vallarta, the Westin has a prime location with great view of the bay.
reviews.title: The Westin is beautiful

reviews.text: Fact: the hotel's gardens and swimming pool are extremely well-kept, although our private whirlpool that came with our suite didn't really work. the private beach is tiny and not very pretty (sand not white, few palm trees)
reviews.title: Lovely, quick stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just arrived home from our honeymoon, so I am writing this immediately while it is still fresh in my mind. My family booked us in for an "all inclusive" 8 day stay in the Westin Resort and Spa. We arrived and had a buffett supper and was given a bill for $890 pesos. ($89 canadian) . I tried to resolve the issue with managment but was told that they are not an all inclusive resort. I am wondering why this resort has been listed under "all inclusive" resorts. Our trip was booked all inclusive and I am still awaiting expedia's response. At any rate I will not be booking with expedia anymore.
reviews.title: All inclusive or not All inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a fantastic two weeks at the Westin P.V.
reviews.title: Great Place to vacation

reviews.text: The hotel was great. There are four pools nicely landscaped with many palm trees.
reviews.title: An awesome place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff throughout the hotel was amazing. They alway had a smile and you get the impression they really enjoy working there.
reviews.title: Nice Resort- Bad Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at the pool area was on point. We always had a drink by our side. The food at the pool area was good and the food at the hotel restaurant was delicious.
reviews.title: Nice and Relaxing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel. The door staff are very friendly. Check in was easy. Great pool with lots of chairs, no need to get up early to reserve. No one was out at the pool before 10:30am. Nikki beach is a nice touch with loungy beds to lie in the sun. I would stay here again. The beds are pretty comfy as well, which is always a determining factor if I would return. The restaurant is also pretty decent, although the service is definitely on mexican time!
reviews.title: Fun stay at the Westin

reviews.text: Where to begin… I have to tell you the most important part or concern I had for the trip was the heat or humidity. It wasn’t as bad as we thought it was going to be. Upon arrival to the airport they will let just about anyone into the country. Not hard at all to get past customs. We had carryon so we did breeze by and then right to a taxi cab driver that was very eager to get us in his car so that we could be hit with the 150.00 peso airport charge. You have to pay it so there is no way around this. We got to the hotel and then had to pay another 40.00 pesos to the cab driver. Everyone was very eager to help us upon entering, but then again we were the only ones that had arrived at that time. Are room was ready the only fault I could say about our room was the location because of the staff making noise. We were in room 1205 which is right next door to the Royal Beach Club on twelfth floor. So every morning we were awoken by loud laughter or just the rolling carts going by our room and the door slamming while the staff prepared the morning breakfast. At times this was very disturbing and we found the only time we did not awake was when we had too much tequila the night before. The benefit about being this close was that we felt like we were going to our kitchen for meals since it was right next door and closes to the elevator. The staff Gladys and Miguel run the Royal Beach club room, they are very nice and when tipped nicely they tend to give you a lot more help on selections of places to go or see.
reviews.title: The Westin was just OKAY.
Westin..the good, bad and the ugly.
reviews.text: The heavenly beds that everyone raves about well I am sorry then I must be sleeping with the angels because my mattress at home is 100 times better then the mattress I was sleeping on.

reviews.title: Don't buy a day trip!
reviews.text: The maid did her best to get to everyone’s room as fast as she possible could and I never complained about my room not being taken care of. The lady that did clean on the twelfth floor was very polite and was very gracious to be getting a tip.

I agree with a comment about the pool that someone else had mentioned that you can not get from point A to point B without swimming across or walking all away around. This is annoying when you are in the heat and want to just get in the pool and you see a lounge chair but when you get there it is already taken. I also thought it was very interesting that you have to get your towel in the designated locations depending on whether you are at the hotel or resort. If we all share the same pool, then why not just have two locations to get towels and not frustrate your customers. Besides it is not like the Regina customers have their own pool, because there was blue/white towels always on the farthest pool closest to the Westin then there was at the pool where a clown was performing for the resort guest.
reviews.title: Four rotten days in PVR and Westin

reviews.text: Lovely property and grounds but, the noise level of this hotel is ridiculous. We were awoken several times on the one night of our stay by guests returning back from the bars. The design of the hotel hallways caused their already loud voices to be amplified and it sounded like they were in our room.
reviews.title: Not enough cotton in Mexico to help at this hotel!
Xmas Relaxation and Fun!
reviews.text: I travel for business 50+ nights a year and have never encountered a similar situation. Be very careful about where your room is located.

Also, the towel management process at the pool is ridiculous. We were a family of four and they were unwilling to give us four towels! It took some insistence on our part to get the other two towels. Not sure what they're intending to protect but, that level of service/attitude is unacceptable in this type of hotel.
reviews.title: This is not a relaxing resort

reviews.text: Wife and I stayed at Westin Resort and Spa - utilized 'points' to upgrade to the Royal Beach Club: Pre-warned (on this site) as to 'numerous' encounters with 'time share' people. Just stay persistent and be gracious but learn to say 'gracias' but NO multiple times. Agree with previous reviewer that, upon leaving baggage area to ignore all the people who what to provide you a ride and go right to the taxi stand at the end of the concourse. Pay the $15 up front and off you go for short ride to your destination.
reviews.title: Party Hotel

likes.disliked: — Noisy; room was not sound proofed.

reviews.text: Had spacious room on 12th floor overlooking the Pacific Ocean - Continental Brkfst (eggs/meat/etc), 5-7 open bar/hors D'Oeuvres in early evening. The rooms were first class with great views of the multiple pools/ocean. No mosquito's and had cool evening breeezes. Had abbreviated newspaper every morning to help you keep up with what's going on in the world. Short walk to Marina (multiple restaurants (liked Morgans and Waffle House). Able to access internet at several coffee shops in Marina. ATM across street at convenience store - converts $ to Peso's. Definitely go down to Nikki Beach Restaurant and trot out to beach/lie on recliners and have dinner at sunset (wow!).
reviews.title: Nice hotel-bit overpriced

aka: Westin Resort And Spa Puerto Vallarta
